title: Can a group be responsible for an action without a single individual being responsible? - Quora

response.answer_text: Easily! Imagine a city of three citizens, asked to vote for one of them as the new mayor. Person A and B both vote for person C as mayor. You could say “A+B elected C as mayor” or that “the electorate elected C as mayor”. But no individual elected C. (In fact, there are more complex examples in which NO individual even wanted the outcome that occurred.)
